This is a fine musical with a timeless score by one of my favorite composers (Gershwin) and a nice 'Parisien' atmosphere which gives the Bostonians, well Bostonians. It's basically an innocent musical since most characters are likeable, although Act III can be very contrived but it usually works.
I think "The Typewriter" is wonderful or it's very original to have couples singing their disagreements onstage. Besides that "Paris Love Song" is superb

Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the people working behind-the-scenes really cared about their film. They may not be professionals by trade or have experience with feature-length films before (obviously), but this movie definitely shows a passion for cinema and creativity.
The acting was great to me. No complaints whatsoever from any of the young actors
